copy.title: Step up and spin
copy.body:
You know credit is important. But how much do you really know about it?
Spin the wheel and play to see just how credit savvy you are.
So come on. Get spinning and earn your certificate.
copy.endcopy: We here at Ford Credit confer upon you the title of Credit Expert. Go forth and use your knowledge to procure a brighter future.

question.text: What should you know before you sign a contract?

choice.text: Cash sale price, down payment and amount financed

question.text: How can ID thieves get your information?

choice.text: By stealing your purse, wallet or mail
By information you use on the Internet

question.text: Dumpster diving is:

choice.text: When people look for usable items for their homes
When thieves steal your trash looking for personal identifiable information

question.text: Some easy ways to protect your credit are:

choice.text: Be careful about sharing your social security number
Carefully review your bank and credit card statements

question.text: The typical ID thief uses the following techniques to steal your identity:
Some basic steps for goal setting are:

choice.text: Buy everything you want immediately in case you get bad credit
Pay yourself first/put financial goals in writing

question.text: Tips to reduce debt are:

choice.text: Minimize impulse spending/live within your budget

question.text: How do you save money?

choice.text: Purchase items only when they are on sale
Make a budget and include savings, and avoid impulse shopping

question.text: What should you consider before purchasing a vehicle?

choice.text: Determine what you can afford and review your credit history
Identify your transportation needs and research price range and other information for the vehicle you wish to obtain

question.text: If you save $100 a month with a 12% return starting at age 25, how much will you have at age 65?
How much money should you keep in an account for emergencies?

choice.text: Three to six months of your salary

question.text: What is Credit?

choice.text: A promise that a borrower makes to a lender to repay money and usually interest
Something you must have to succeed in life
A promise that a borrower makes to a lender to repay money

question.text: What are some ways to establish credit?
What is the most common type of credit?
A secured credit card can be used to help you establish credit.
A cosigner is not legally obligated to make any and all payments you cannot.
You may be able to negotiate the price of a vehicle, the apr and payment terms with your dealer.

Revolving credit is credit that is repeatedly available up to a specified amount as periodic repayments are made. The costs, repayments and limits vary and you may pay only a portion of the balance every month.
What are the warning signs of poor credit?

choice.text: Barely making minimum payments or being maxed out on your credit limit
No more room in your closets

question.text: What should you do if you cannot make your payments?

choice.text: Call lenders to work out a payment agreement and explain your situation
Do not answer your phone unless you know who it is
Change your phone number so lenders cannot find you

question.text: Impulse purchases cause many, many credit problems.
Cancelling an account does not erase the record of late payments.
How long do detrimental items generally stay on your credit report?
How do you maintain good credit?

choice.text: Pay on time and at least the minimum due
Call creditors if you have problems making your payments

question.text: Who cares about good credit?
How often should you check your credit report?

choice.text: Once a year at a minimum
When you apply for new credit

question.text: You can get a free credit report:
Why is credit useful?

choice.text: Because you may not have the cash on hand to purchase large-ticket items like homes, vehicles and a college education
Because the credit that is built today could be one of the keys to getting the car, apartment or even job you want in the future

question.text: What is a credit score?

choice.text: A number often used by lenders to determine a person’s creditworthiness
It represents the likelihood a person will repay his/her debt
Something you use to get into the college of your choice

question.text: Your credit score is made up of the following:

choice.text: Amount of debt and length of debt
Amount of new debt and the type of credit

question.text: What has the biggest impact on your credit score?
An excellent credit score is considered to be 775 and above according to the major credit agencies.
Who are the main credit reporting agencies?
Unpaid medical bills and tax liens can show up on your credit report.
Your credit score can impact your access to credit and the interest rate you pay.
